subject: air
author: Stefan Bion
full_text:
Hi Margaret,

could 'air' perhaps mean 'sound waves'? Although I personally don't
think that sound is the key.

Stefan

-- 

> Hi Bruce.  I hear most the content in your clips as you are.  On this one, I believe it says, "I
> will get us AIR speech."  I have repeatedly been told with this method that 'air' has 
> something to do with the communication.  

> Not sure what Arthur's definition of 'air' is, but it is definitely key to what is taking place.  
> He's used terms and phrases like "Air-to-air" - "Air Ports" - "Air Portals" - "Helps you 
> enter our air" - "They'll give you air to us" - "I have air" etc.  MANY references.

> Margaret
